title: Issue forks
description: Drupal contributors may now collaborate using git branches and merge requests. Until this day, code collaboration on drupal.org featured uploading patch files.

title: Australian government standardizes on Drupal. A symbol of Drupal's growing popularity with governments all over the world.
SA-CORE-2014-005 - Drupal core - SQL injection
description: Many thousands of Drupal sites are compromised by Drupal core's first major security vulnerability.

title: Drupal 6.0 released
description: This release features a rewritten menu system, and an Update Status module which prompts admins to update their modules, especially after a security release.

title: Drupal 5.0 is released
description: This release incorporates jQuery, a young open source project. Drupal's support helps jQuery gain attention and then it rises to huge popularity. This release introduces install profiles and a web based installer.

title: Drupal 4.7 is released with a Form API.
description: The new Form API by Adrian Rossouw strengthens Drupal's secure-by-default approach. XSS protections, validation of choices, and only processing POST data that was actually on the form.

title: Drupal security team is formed
description: This volunteer team is first led by chx. The team dutifully protects Drupal core and all the contrib modules that opt into its coverage.

title: Drupalers build Deanspace, a semi-official presence for USA presidential candidate Howard Dean.
description: This was a milestone in the rise of the Internet rise as a political rallying force. It also kicked off a long love affair between Drupal and non-profits.

title: Drupal 4.0 is released, with a new taxonomy module.
description: Taxonomy module, written by Marco Molinari. Marco wrote it because he needed a way to group forums into categories. Drupal's rich taxonomy system foreshadows what will be popularly known as tags/labels.

title: Drupal 3.0 is released.
description: 3.0 major had a whopping 6 month development cycle. Nodes are introduced as a building block for content. They can be specialized into many content types.

title: Druplicon is introduced
description: Drupal's famous logo, featuring infinity eyes and remixed into thousands of variants, is introduced by Steven Wittens and Kristjan Jansen.

title: Drupal 1.0 is released
description: A mere 2 months after 1.0, Drupal ships 2.0. Backward compatibility was not yet a concern. The translation system is introduced, with its brilliantly simple t() function.

title: Drupal 1.0 is released
description: Dries Buytaert shares the initial release of his 'dormitory bulletin board'. Drupal is modular from the start. It includes 18 files that are called modules. It features a hook system where modules interact with each other and the core framework.
